column2: found throughout the lands of Middle-earth
column3: but especially in the highlands of Dorthonion
column4: a land which took its name from the pine trees that grew there.

column1: The Sindarin name for a "pine-tree" is thôn.

column2: Ilkorin thōn and Noldorin thaun (pl. thuin)

column1: In Tolkiens very early conception of the Elvish languages (dating from ca. 1917)
column2: the Gnomish name for a "pinetree" is aigos and the Qenya name is aikasse#Qenya.
